instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Have a <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with soda damage. Replaced everything affected by the spill but still no fan spin.

Checked power rails and <SIGNAL>PP5V_SUS</SIGNAL> is pulsing up to 0.135V then 0v. Replaced <TRANSISTOR>Q7840</TRANSISTOR> and <DIODE>D2400</DIODE> but same results. Checked and have no shorts. Drawing steady 0.15amps on power supply

What to try next?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: Just warning even if if you fix this it will have a dead GPU

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Resistance to ground at <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> rail?
Disconnect <RESISTOR>R5805</RESISTOR> and see if symptom changes.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
I plan on replacing the GPU with a new one.

0.434

0.403 with <RESISTOR>R5805</RESISTOR> removed

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Bad <CHIP>U5805</CHIP> I suppose.
Do you get short to ground at <RESISTOR>R5806</RESISTOR>?
Does the board start now?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
No short on <RESISTOR>R5806</RESISTOR>

Put <RESISTOR>R5805</RESISTOR> back on and replaced <CHIP>U5805</CHIP> but still not starting

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message: fan spin after trying apple charger instead of power supply

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Does it work now?
It requires to connect bench power supply through 85W cable, when no charger available...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> not turning on
threads.message:
Yes but pink lines through screen... should be fixed after GPU replacement.

cable on bench power supply is suppose to be 85 watt but board only draws 0.15 amps on it. Power up no problem on standard apple 85 watt ac adapter
